candidates.title: Update to glutin 0.23
candidates.body: WIP as I need to figure out a solution to the `examples/support/mod.rs` build failure (see https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/issues/1387).

candidates.title: Release 0.26.0-alpha6
candidates.body:
Getting out a new release for #1815.
Going to wait for #1814 before merging though.

candidates.title: Use glutin 0.22.0-alpha6
candidates.body: 0.22.0-alpha6 locks winit to a compatible version, it fails to compile otherwise because it tries to use winit 0.20.0 instead of 0.20.0-alpha4 (see https://github.com/rust-windowing/glutin/commit/5947a22bbd62fe3b39601d6100563aaab352a315#diff-1b6d60f3f005be6e1e05f2803da7ccc6)

candidates.title: Update gl_generator and remove use of invalid value
Fix benchmarks
candidates.body:
Benchmarks needed a tiny bit of love. They're running again.

Tested via `cargo bench --all-features`.

- Adds a dev dependency on libc (required by benchmarks)
- Fixes some imports
- Fixes a template error on Context
- Some small formatting fixes

candidates.title: Adopt memoffset crate and use it to fix two invalid_value lints
Fix deferred example
candidates.body: Fixes the last unfixed example. Closes #1758

candidates.title: Updating to glutin 0.22.0-alpha1 / winit 0.22.0-alpha1
candidates.body:
Updated the dependencies, and changed the parts of the code where the EventLoop struct appears. This bumps the glium version to 0.25.1-alpha1.
The examples have not been updated or tested yet.

candidates.title: Fix some nightly warnings
candidates.body:
* Fix a couple of warnings that recent nightly now emits
* Suppress a deprecation warning in a macro expose
* Release 0.25.1 so that users don't get the deprecation warning

repo.name: glium
repo.description: Safe OpenGL wrapper for the Rust language.

repo.name: glium
repo.description: Safe OpenGL wrapper for the Rust language.
